name: migratory
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A migratory bird or animal is one that migrates (= travels to a different place, usually when the season changes): migratory birds Sea eagles are not migratory, so once extinct, there is no chance of them returning naturally.
relating to the migration (= travel in large numbers to a different place) of animals, birds, or people: The satellite tag will track the turtle's migratory route for the first time. The Rio Grande is a major migratory corridor for birds. See
migrate
More examplesFewer examplesThere are about 350 species of migratory songbirds, according to U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service estimates.Records show that migratory birds fly to higher latitudes earlier in the season and stay later.The fish are extremely migratory, covering miles of ocean. Some say the population hasn't swelled here because the area is far from traditional migratory labor routes.

having the characteristic of moving regularly to another place: migratory birds
